text:
Ana María Pastor Julián (born 11 November 1957) is a Spanish doctor and politician for the People's Party who was President of the Congress of Deputies from 19 July 2016 to 20 May 2019. She was Minister of Health from 2002 to 2004 and Minister of Public Works from 2011 to 2016.
Since 20 May 2019 is the Second Vice President of the Congress of Deputies.
On 11 March 2020, during the ongoing coronavirus outbreak, Pastor had tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.

annotations.surface_form: President of the Congress of Deputies
Second Vice President of the Congress of Deputies
